details: “Y” is the twenty-fifth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents both a consonant sound, as in 'yes', and a vowel sound, as in 'my'. The letter 'Y' is commonly used in words related to questions, youth, and yellow.

wordsData.definition: a bright color that is the color of ripe lemons or the sun
wordsData.example: She wore a yellow dress to the party.

wordsData.definition: a long, continuous length of thread used for knitting or weaving
wordsData.example: She used colorful yarn to make a scarf.

wordsData.definition: a large, luxurious boat used for sailing or cruising
wordsData.example: They spent the weekend on their yacht.

wordsData.definition: a system of physical and mental exercises aimed at promoting health and well-being
wordsData.example: She practices yoga every morning to stay fit.

rhymes.name: Y is for Yellow (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: Y is for yellow, bright and bold,
A color of sunshine, warmth to hold.
From flowers to bananas, shining bright,
Y is for yellow, a cheerful sight.

rhymes.name: Y is for Yoga (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: Y is for yoga, stretch and bend,
It helps your body and mind to mend.
From head to toes, feel the release,
Y is for yoga, bring you peace!
